Deficiency Narrative: The EBI policy is missing a complete description of the types of EBI that they plan to permit for use by the caregivers.
Correction Narrative: 07/21/2025-The operation's CEO submitted to Licensing via email the corrective action plan indicating that the operation has drafted as well as implemented a detailed EBI policy that describes each permitted intervention (CPI approval holds, verbal de-escalation, transport positions).

Deficiency Narrative:
During the inspection walk-through, it was observed that the shower light in one of the bathrooms on the 2nd floor did not appear to be working.

Also, during the walk-through the fence surrounding the backyard had multiple nails needed to be removed or nailed into the fence properly.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided proof that the light had been replaced and is in working order.

Deficiency Narrative: The serious incident form was missing an area for the operation to provide the child's age, the child's gender, and the resolution to the incident.
Correction Narrative: 07/21/2025-The operation's CEO submitted to Licensing via email the corrective action plan indicating that the CEO revised the Serious Incident Report form to include fields for the child's age, gender, and a section for the resolution/outcome.

Deficiency Narrative: The policy is missing the required general pre-service training components regarding Emergency Behavior Intervention and Normalcy.
Correction Narrative: 07/21/2025-The operation's CEO submitted to Licensing via email the corrective action plan indicating that the CEO has revised the personnel policies to include mandatory pre-service training topics, specifically EBI as well as Normalcy.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation policies included conflicting information. There were instances of other operation names in the policy, conflicting information regarding the services planned to offer.
Correction Narrative: 07/21/2025-The operation's CEO submitted to Licensing via email the corrective action plan indicating that the operation conducted a full review as well as edited the operation's policy to identify as well as correct inaccurate operation names.

Deficiency Narrative: The medication log form was missing the opportunity for the operation to provide the dosage information.
Correction Narrative: The operation has chosen to adopt and use the HHSC medication administration logs.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, in review of the administrators file, it was observed that the required Pre-Employment Affidavit for Applicants for Employment at certain Child Care Operations (form 2912) was missing.
Correction Narrative: 07/21/2025-The operation's CEO submitted to Licensing via email the corrective action plan indicating that the operation has adopted including downloading as well as completing Form 2912 for the Administrator and any other staff who are missing it in their files.

Deficiency Narrative: The policy does not notate how the operation staff will integrate TIC into the care, treatment, and management of each child.
Correction Narrative: 07/21/2025-The operation's CEO submitted to Licensing via email the corrective action plan indicating that the operation has drafted as well as adopted a written policy titled Trauma Informed Care in Discipline and Treatment, outlining Trauma Informed Care principles and integration into behavior management.

Deficiency Narrative:
Regarding standard 748.121(4), the policy does not include strategies of coordination between the operation and appropriate community organizations. 

Regarding standard 748.121(5), the policy does not include actions that the parent of the child who is a victim of ANE should take to obtain assistance and intervention.
Correction Narrative: 07/21/2025-The operation's CEO submitted to Licensing via email the corrective action plan indicating that the operation has developed a policy related to abuse and neglect as well as integrated withing the policies and procedures.

Deficiency Narrative: The policy does not include that an employee may not delegate the responsibility to make a report and that you may not require an employee to seek approval to file a report or to notify you that a report was made.
Correction Narrative: 07/21/2025-The operation's CEO submitted to Licensing via email the corrective action plan indicating that the CEO has updated the personnel policy to include a clear statement that all employees are legally required to report suspected abuse, neglect, or exploitation directly to DFPS and my not delegate this responsibility.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, in review of the administrators file, it was observed that the reference information was missing.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided documentation to verify that two reference checks were completed as part of the pre-employment screening process.

Deficiency Narrative: There is no policy on screening applicants, nor verifying employment history and conducting reference checks.
Correction Narrative: 07/21/2025-The operation's CEO submitted to Licensing via email the corrective action plan indicating that the operation has developed as well as implemented a written policy on applicant screening, including steps for employment history verification as well as reference checks within the policy.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, in review of the administrators file, it was observed that the documentation results from prior employers were missing.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a completed pre-employment screening for the administrator.

Deficiency Narrative: The policy is missing components for authority and frequency of services for staff members.
Correction Narrative: 07/21/2025-The operation's CEO submitted to Licensing via email the corrective action plan indicating the operation has developed a comprehensive written professional staffing plant that includes qualifications, duties, responsibilities, authority, and frequency of services for each role as well as integrated into the official personnel policies.
